en.text: Zheng Guogu (born 1970, Yangjiang) graduated from the Printmaking Department of Guangzhou Academy of Fine Arts in 1992. A key member of the Yangjiang Group, he creates conceptual work in the form of photography, calligraphy, painting, and video installation. His work addresses the profound shifts of southern Chinese culture, specifically the Pearl River Delta region, with a particular focus on local culture in a time of globalisation. Zheng lives and works in Yangjiang.

After graduating from the Sichuan Fine Arts Institute in 1995,

Yang Yong went to Shenzhen to seek new opportunities.

Before becoming an artist, he dabbled in design and

commercial photography. These experiences influenced

Yang’s later artistic practice, which uses photography as the

primary medium to record the bizarre and mixed lifestyles

and subcultures of Shenzhen. After moving to Beijing, Yang

began painting as a way to reproduce his photographs.

zh-hant.text: 鄭國谷 (1970年生於陽江，現工作及生活於陽江)，1992年廣州美術學院版畫系畢業，是陽江組的主要成員之一。他的攝影、書法、繪畫及錄像裝置作品主要探討處身於全球化下的南中國，特別是珠三角地區的本地文化所面對的重大變化。

中國著名概念藝術家。1992 年畢業於廣州美術學院版畫系，2002 年

參與創立藝術團體「陽江組」。作品橫跨攝影、錄像、行為、裝置、書法

等多種媒介，以即興、幽默的方式，探討改革開放後珠三角以至中國

南方一帶的社會與文化議題。
